channel.title: How To Hide Server ip in the client?
channel.description:
Well, guys i need a little help, how should i hide my server ip in client i mean how to remove the thing where it says
Server ip: port:
I just want to hide my port and ip so crashers cant get onto server :)

item.title: How To Hide Server ip in the client?
item.dc:creator: @xAnonymous xAnonymous
item.description:
@xAnonymous wrote:

Ok, im looking through your “secret” client, can’t find ip.
Start>Run> ping yourserver.com
Got it.

Not trying to be a buzzkill but this is pointless.

Read full topic
item.source: How To Hide Server ip in the client?

item.title: How To Hide Server ip in the client?
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

[quote=“Javaboy, post:4, topic:255405”][b]All i do is this;

  1. Go to client.java.
  2. Search for:

Server IP:

Or whatever it says on the client.

  1. Find where it is, and delete it.

  2. Compile & Run.[/b][/quote]

Ooooo client.java?

Read full topic

item.title: How To Hide Server ip in the client?
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

There is really no way to ‘hide’ the ip and port.

Only way I could see is, sticking the ip and port into your config file and turning the jar file into an exe.

Read full topic
